V, v noun [C or U]
(NUMBER)
(also v) the sign used in the Roman system for the number 5

v preposition
(AGAINST)
(also vs.) used to show the two sides involved in a court case: the 1973 Supreme Court decision, Roe v Wade
UK (also vs.) used to show who is competing in a game: Newcastle United v Wigan
UK (also vs.) used to compare two things or ideas, especially when you have to choose between them: I need to consider the advantages v the disadvantages. Synonym
versus

v preposition
(VERY)
